name: JW Marriott San Francisco Union Square

reviews.title: Relaxing Weekend in San Fran
reviews.text: We just returned from a very relaxing weekend in the city. I'm a frequent travler to San Fran and have stayed in many hotels all over the city and the Pan Pacific is one of my fav's. It's location is unbeatable - right off Union Square. It is a little less hetic being a block away from Union Square, but still very close, so within seconds you are in the middle of it all. I liked how the lobby was on the third floor; it made it very calm and away from the hustle of Post St. I enjoyed sitting by the fire in the lobby enjoying a drink. Our room was awesome, very large! The bed was wonderful, one of the best hotel beds. The bathroom was also awesome, with a separate shower and tub, all surrounded by black marble. All in all it was a great weekend shopping, relaxing, but the best part by far was the Pan Pacific.

We stayed five nights at the Pan, with a two-night break in the middle of our stay. After the first three nights, we agreed that the hotel was just missing the mark....it was almost excellent. We never felt "welcomed" when we checked in; the gentleman at the front desk simply wasn't friendly.
reviews.title: Nearly excellent hotel
Slept like a Baby
reviews.text: The rooms are average size, but didn't feel cramped. The bathrooms are small, but ours had a separate tub/shower which was a nice touch. The bathrooms are beautifully appointed. The butler service is a nice touch. The hotel definitely does not want its guests doing for themselves--if you want ice, contact your butler to bring it, because it's not available at the end of the hall!

There is a courtesy car service, which was one of the selling points for us. However, it is not available on Sunday, not available between 9:30a-5:30p, and doesn't go beyond a two-mile radius. Fisherman's Wharf was too far. In fact, we weren't able to use the "courtesy" car until we went to the airport, for which we paid a $45 fee.
reviews.title: Loved the Pan Pacific
Excellent Hotel
reviews.text: On our return for the last two nights, we had a more enjoyable check-in. We learned that the valet would return our rental car for a $5 fee (could be worth if if you don't want to deal with traffic). In the end, this is a very Japanese hotel--the staff was obedient; they reacted to our needs but didn't well anticipate them.

We were staying at the Pan Pacific for our anniversary and booked our trip through priceline. According to the Pan Pacific's rates, the cheapest room in the place is $340 per night, but we found a great all-inclusive deal that averaged out to about $100 per night. The service was above average, but not as excellent as all of the reviews that I had read. The staff was friendly and helpful, especially at the concierge desk. After a long travel day, our room wasn't ready when we arrived, and it took a little prompting on my part to speed up the process - which I shouldn't have to do. Everything else was extremely positive after that, though. The concierge was very helpful in booking us a rental car. The room was very clean and nicely decorated. It's not a huge room, but we weren't in our room very often anyways. Another note about the room - the street noise is pretty loud at times; I woke to the sounds of bottles being dumped into a bin from the lounge across the street and the ambulance/police sirens a few times as the windows are single-paned and don't keep out sound very well. The workout room on the 5th floor was nice, and it seemed to be getting regular use from the hotel guests. It was maintained very well. We didn't eat at the restaurant, and it didn't look as though it received a lot of business. The menu looked great, but was pricey. Housecleaning was fantastic! They really did a nice job each day on our room. The Pan Pacific is convenient for getting on the bus line and trolley lines. Most lines were 1-3 blocks away. Finally, I liked the 3rd floor lobby. It was a good choice for placing the lobby, as we didn't have to walk through crowds to get to our room. We could just bypass all of that with the elevator. By the way - the glass elevators are a nice touch! We will definitely stay at the Pan Pacific again. We encountered many other tourists at different SF sights asking us where we were staying, and they said that we were lucky to be there because of the reputation of the place. Plus, many others weren't enamored with their accomodations. That felt good to know that on our first trip, we hit it on the mark with our hotel choice!
reviews.title: A great value in a prime location

reviews.text: As a family of 4, we all loved the Pan Pacific. The kids really thought it was great to have a TV in the bathroom. The beds were very comfortable and the room was nicely decorated. The hotel was very clean. Some others have complained about construction noise but we didn't hear any noise during our 2 night stay and never saw any construction around the hotel. Staff was very nice. We were allowed early check-in without any hassle. We would definitely stay again and recommend it to others.
reviews.title: Pan Pacific was great!

reviews.text: We arrived from Hawaii before 6 am having booked 2 rooms near each other for our family (husband, me and 2 teenage boys). I had advised them when I booked that we were coming in early and they said they would see what they could. As it was so early I didn't expect anyone would have checked out and was dreading facing several sleep-deprived hours somewhere before we could get a room.
reviews.title: This is how you define service

reviews.text: The manager immediately started looking for available rooms as ours were not ready. He located two, but on different floors; we wanted them on the same floor at minimum. He found one available for us and another that would open up later in the day. Within 15 minutes of our arrival, we were in the room (our bags having been delivered without having to do anything), resting and so relieved to have a place to stay before exploring SF.
reviews.title: very satisfied with the pan pacific
Just wonderful
reviews.text: What really impressed me was that I never heard "well, it IS hours before normal checkout" or "Not sure we can find something". In fact, they didn't even treat it as a problem as has been my experience at other hotels. They were just delighted to help us and did so in a very pleasant and efficient manner.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the JW Marriot for only one night, but it was the nicest hotel on our road trip. The front desk was very helpful and courteous and the room was very comfortable. The bed was great, as was the bathroom. I rarely take baths in hotel rooms, but I did here, because of the nice fixtures and TV. This hotel is walking distance to many sights and Union Square.
reviews.title: Great hotel in the middle of everything!

likes.liked: — comfortable bed and nice bathroom, courteous service

reviews.text: We stayed at the JW Marriott in downtown San Francisco for 3 nights in Sept. The location of the hotel is perfect, just 4 blocks from the BART station, in the midst of Union Square with lots of chain shops but also some boutiques, great restaurants, theatres and at least one nightclub. A new Bloomingdales opened up a couple blocks away the week after our visit.
reviews.title: Excellent stay at the JW Union Square

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The lobby and reception areas are very nice. The room was nice size (we had a double double), large bathroom with a tub and separate shower. The furniture and carpet in the room do need an update and this is my sole complaint with the hotel. But the beds were very comfortable, the windows open, and the a/c was incredibly quiet. Front desk, doormen, and housekeeping staff were all very friendly and courteous. Turn down service was a nice touch.
reviews.title: Great Weekend

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our stay was September 21-24th. We used the BART from the airport and walked about 4 blocks to the property from the Powell Street Station. We discovered this was a great central location and a good value for the price (after comparing to other properties in the area).
reviews.title: Marriott's first Five Star hotel in San Francisco

likes.disliked: — Cost of parking but that is universal across the downtown area.

reviews.text: Quick, friendly check-in (which was true of all of our experiences with the staff - they were friendly, gracious, helpful, respectful, knowledgeable and observant). Room service was quickly delivered our first night. The room was clean and daily maid service was excellent, though I agree with a previous post that the room itself is showing some minor signs of wear and tear (scuff marks, start of peeling wallpaper, etc); also, the mattress "pillow" seemed a bit worn and not nearly as comfortable as other Marriotts where we've stayed, but it was adequate and not important enough to report to the management. Otherwise, the room was spacious enough for two of us to prepare for the day each morning and comfortable enough to stretch out in the evening. Loved the bathroom setup (didn't watch too much TV in there though).
reviews.title: Very Nice Hotel

likes.liked: — the comfortable beds and great service

reviews.text: I just returned from my trip tp San Francisco and I must say the Pan Pacific hotel is one of the best hotels I have ever stayed in. Everyone was friendly and the service was outstanding. The only downside is the location as it's in Union Square. However, it's a city, and like all city it's busy.
reviews.title: Would stay there again
Luxury Room -Not!
reviews.text: When seeing our room, that was standard, we decided to upgrade. Given choice of Deluxe or Luxury, we choose Luxury. Well, it was larger, but the bathroom was not as well equiped as the standard, no TV and smaller. Definately not worth the extra $50 per night. It took 30 minutes just to get a bucket of ice both evenings we were there. The room and beds were very comfortable, but for the price and service, I would try another hotel next time visiting San Francisco.

reviews.title: Great hotel,Great price
reviews.text: I just spent a weekend at the Pan Pacific. Our room rate averaged $100. per night for a three day stay! The hotel was five star in all respects. I have stayed in many ultra luxury five star hotels, but have never experienced a better hotel for the money. The hotel has been recently rennovated and the rooms were clean and well appointed with a flat screen television and a second tv in the bathroom. The concierge and staff were great. We even got to use their complimentary limo a couple of times.

reviews.title: Great Hotel, Terrific deal
reviews.text: We stayed three nights. The hotel is in a top location off Union Square.

reviews.title: Quiet class
reviews.text: If you like an active lobby with ornate furniture this is not for you. But if you like contemporary style, plush bathrooms, and attentive--but not stuffy--service, you'll like this. Everyone was friendly and helpful--door men, concierge, check-in, etc. Also, if you book by June 30 with Amex, you pay 1/2 price and the third night is free--essentially 3 nights for the price of one (rack rate).

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: What a great location! Just walk a block to Union Square or take the cable car to Ghirardelli Square. BART is not too far away either. You get a real sense of the "San Francisco" experience in downtown and this hotel fits right in.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel, lovely amenities and great location.

reviews.text: The only down side was parking. Advertised as "valet only" parking we didn't realize it would be as expensive. The sign as you pull in says $51 but in reality, with fees and taxes, it was $62. We opted to park across the street for $32 for 24 hours.
reviews.title: Nice somewhat older hotel near Union Square

reviews.text: The staff is friendly and helpful - rooms are lovely. The lobby has beautiful decor and they offer free appetizers and desserts on week nights. The indoor glass elevators are fun! Not one problem with the room, staff or other amenities.
reviews.title: Location and service!

reviews.text: One thing I've always wondered though is why do the high end hotels charge for wifi when the less expensive offer for free. Wifi here is $12.95 per day. I did go to the lobby to print our boarding passes but was unable to do so. After calling the airline they said they'd had the complaint before and it had something to do with the hotels firewall.
reviews.title: Grand hotel makes great first impression

reviews.text: Breakfast is nice - a bit pricey at $26 for full breakfast. The buffet is $21. The food is good and served promptly.
reviews.title: Luxury Hotel in perfect Location

reviews.text: Very well run 4 star hotel. Good service, unbeatable Union Sq location. The rooms are nicely furnished with marble bathrooms, very comfortable bedding and butler service on request for all rooms. We had a good breakfast at the Pacific restaurant. It is not your only choice however as there are many restaurants within a block or 2. The door man found us a nice town car limo to the airport for only $44, same price as a cab. Highly recommended hotel.
reviews.title: Very Good! Great Service and Location.

reviews.text: We booked through Expedia at $180. I think it was a good value for the city location, one block from Union Square and cablecar stop, two blocks from Chinatown. Sears is the traditional, nostalgic place for breakfast (Swedish pancakes, 1.5 blocks away, line moves quickly). Bathroom was best feature of room with marble, TV, separate tub and shower. Beds were quite comfortable, coffeepot is single serve though. Views were not awesome (we saw a dentist at work in a nearby building), but we didn't spend time in room much (too much to do in the city). Macy's, Tiffany's, Neiman-Marcus, Saks are nearby for shoppers.
reviews.title: Enjoyed the room and especailly the location
Loved our stay
reviews.text: High-speed internet is not free. Dining is expensive (as expected), but many restaurants nearby. We read other reviews enough to know to walk 1-2 blocks for $28 parking garage (instead of valet almost twice that). We didn't take advantage of an luxury elements of the hotel (young family). Service was good (able to change rooms when crying baby was nextdoor).
All-in-all we selected a very good place with a hotel great chain. We would probably stay again.
reviews.title: Great hotel!

reviews.text: We arrived in San Francisco late so we just booked a room at the airport for one night and head into the city the next morning. The Clarion Hotel at the airport was absolutely aweful! I would say if rated lower than a "terrible". Hotel was dirty, room was small, smelled like smoke although we asked for a non-smoking room.,
reviews.title: Great stay at the Pan!

reviews.text: Stay here around once a year and hotel always remembers preferences (NY Times, high floor etc) without being reminded. Great new beds, superb service, great value for San Francisco.
reviews.title: Consistently great
Pan Pacific Hits the Spot
reviews.text: We spent three days at the Pan Pacific over the Labour Day weekend. The person on the front desk was friendly and professional and swiftly checked us in. Our room was beautiful (superior king). It was a large room with a fresh contemporary design. The bathroom was luxurious - a sunken bath, a shower with good pressure (a must!), large sink with a large well lit mirror; and the toilet was discretely tucked behind a dividing wall.

Other reviewers have expressed concern about the noise so I felt I should comment on this. Our room looked onto a side street and although there was some noise, I only noticed this on the first night - for me it was just a case of adjusting to the city.
reviews.title: Great hotel, great location, great staff....
Very Satisfied
reviews.text: Daytime concierge was very friendly and helpful - although we were given misinformation in terms of the nearest MUNI stop.

reviews.title: Good Location, Decent hotel
reviews.text: A word on room service - in the morning the service was excellent - be aware that there is a wider room service menu than the room card would suggest - I made the mistake of thinking the breakfast choices were very limited and later discovered that there were more choices in the hotel welcome book! Regardless, the service was efficient and friendly. However, the same cannot be said for evening room service. We called down for room service at about 10:30pm and received no response; concierge picked up the phone and he said he would call us back, but no return call was made! This was a real disappointment as this did not reflect the usual efficient service.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here from July 1-4. We were torn between the Marriott Marquis or this property. I am so glad we chose the JW. The service was great. They were able to let us check in early, gave us all the information we could ask for and then some, and overall the staff was happy and friendly. The concierge helped us make plans and made some great recommendations for our meals. The room was clean and comfortable.The only thing lacking is a view...but really I didn't care at all. I was only in my room to sleep, so the view was not important. The location was perfect for us. It was just a couple minutes walk to where all of the Hop on Hop Off buses pick up and drop off (which we took advantage of), right off the Cable Car line, and surrounded by restaurants and shopping. We were central to every where we needed to be. We will definitely be staying here on our next trip to San Francisco!
reviews.title: Great Hotel, Perfect Location

reviews.text: Stayed here a few days after 4th of July. Great location just 1 block from all the action at Union Square. I had a funky problem with an opening behind the sink area. Called "at your service" and an engineer was up there within 5 minutes to get my iitems and then the area was repaired while we were out touring the city during the day. Had the priviledge to have concierge lounge access and the breakfast and evening desserts were great. I never took part in any evening hospitality. The room was spacious and uber clean. Valet worked well. Valet charges are higher than some other properties in the city and although I didn't have to pay it, I still find the 12.95 fee for wifi just ridiculous. I never used the lounge or restaurant finding too many more desirable options just steps outside the door.
reviews.title: Great Property Great Location

reviews.text: We booked two rooms & accidentally booked one at another Marriott property. The staff was more than accommodating and switched things around for us. We ended up with two very comfortable, clean rooms. Great views and wow..,,the beds are awesome!!!
reviews.title: Most comfortable nights sleep & excellent service!!!
Great views over San Fran
reviews.text: I wish we could have spent a week there.

Great hotel close to union square. Vallet parking worked very well. We also had a lounge access and the lounge had great breakfast. Rooms were nice and we had the view towards the Golden Gate bridge. When it was not foggy, we were able to see the bridge. The JW is better than Marriott in general and I was positively surprised.
reviews.title: Great Hotel at the heart of San Francisco

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed at the Marriott from Dec 27 - January 2. The location cannot be beat. Only one block from Union Square. Being a smaller hotel (about 400 rooms) the front desk staff recognized us by name, and was an example of the difference between a smaller hotel versus the 1,000 + room San Francisco Marriott on 4th and Mission St.
reviews.title: Great location & quality staff

likes.liked: — No car is necessary. BART can be used from the airport.

reviews.text: The hotel management took great efforts to keep the noise down on New Years eve, and even posted extra security in the lobby. We felt very comfortable and safe in this hotel.
reviews.title: No Problems

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Service was excellent. Everyone welcomed us with a greeting and a smile.
reviews.title: Good stay at the Marriott

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed at this location many times when it was the Pan Pacific but this was my first visit since it has become JW Marriott. I was a little leery do to some of the other reviews, but had a great stay. No complaints, whatsoever. Cleanliness, service and rooms were all great. Looks as if they are planning a renovation for later this year, so things should only get better.
reviews.title: JW Marriott is nice, but a bit dated.
Wonderful 10th Anniversary
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed at the Pan Pacific several years ago, before it became the JW Marriott, and we were very happy with our stay. For the most part, Marriott continues the tradition. The bed was large and comfortable, the view was good and the service was excellent. The only problem was that the walls seemed to be very thin and every morning we could hear our "neighbors" who had 2 children. The father would talk on his phone and the children would scream, yell and run around; all this would start at about 7AM. Marriott would be well advised to invest in some sound insulation of some sort or keep families with children near each other. The location is only one block from the center of union square, which should be a key point in choosing a hotel in San Francisco. We like the JW Marriott, but we love the Pan Pacific.

We were very impressed with the Pan Pacific. Great location, close to transport, shopping and good restaurants. A huge hotel but didn't feel impersonal, service was swift and friendly at all times. We got a good deal through Expedia and felt is was great value for money - would definitely go back there when visiting San Francisco again.
reviews.title: Great location in San Francisco
Very nice
reviews.text: PS: though I've heard much mention of the 'construction' we did not see or hear it.
Very nice experience at this hotel. Booked on line thru a discounter so was not dissapointed with lack of a view.. with the price we paid it was worth it!
reviews.title: You get your own butler regardless of room choice!!!
Impressed
reviews.text: Only one gripe was having to pay close to $8 to print out my plane boarding passes thru their business center. Felt it should be a free feature at a hotel of this class.
But I highly recommend the hotel for its location, amenities and luxury (Bathroom was incredible)!!
reviews.title: Excellent choice for the picky traveler

reviews.text: Stayed here 3 night for a conference and brought my husband and daughter so they could sightsee while I worked! Hotel is very nice, room was very pleasant but bathroom quite small. We were quite high up but the cable car noise was still very noisy. Best thing about the hotel was the doorman -- so nice and pleasant and funny! A real joy everytime you want in and out. Conceirge was great too. Cable car stop right nearby. I think if I was strictly a tourist I would stay closer to the bay because it's very expensive to take the cable car or a cab ($20) to get to the Piers or any of the main attractions.
reviews.title: Doormen were the best!

reviews.text: I got a good deal on this hotel using Priceline, and was more than pleased with the quality when I arrived. The location is very convenient, about equidistant from two BART stations, the cable car turnaround, and tons of shops.
reviews.title: Great Location

reviews.text: My room was clean and nice - the bathroom was separated from the sleeping area by a small hallway, something I really like in a hotel room.
reviews.title: Nice hotel...mixed reaction

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff was all very pleasant, polite, and helpful when needed.
reviews.title: Marriott Gold Member Review - WOW!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There was a bit of street noise so I'd ask for a high floor if possible, but it wasn't enough for me to find very disruptive.
reviews.title: Beautiful hotel and great location
Service is wonderful!
reviews.text: After an exhausing two-week tour of northern California, we ended at the Pan Pacific. The attendants wouldn't hear of us touching our luggage, and were happy to return our rental car for us for a $5 charge. The reception desk (on the third floor of all places!) had a big bowl of fresh apples and they made us feel very welcome, and our luggage arrived almost immediately. The zen-like rooms were calming and relaxing. The bathroom, including a TV and phone, was something else---taking a bath became a must! They have a butler button which you push for any need (ice, more bathrobes, maps, pillow service, anything) which they cater to immediately. We had a bunch of stuff to ship and asked where we could find a shipping place--they took it, wrapped it, and shipped it for a nominal charge. We had to check our bags at the end of our trip (taking the red-eye home) and they were ready when we returned to catch the taxi to the airport which they were to call for us--except they gave us the hotel car (much, much nicer) for the taxi price, instead. I've been in service-oriented hotels before, but not like this. It was the perfect way to end our trip.

reviews.title: Outstanding Hotel!
reviews.text: From the time we checked in, until checkout, the 4 days at the Pan Pacific was the highlight of a 10 day California vacation!

reviews.title: Great Hotel for an AWESOME Price !!!
reviews.text: Everyone was very helpful and efficient with always a friendly greeting, the best cocierge desk. Our large room was immaculate and very comfortable. The huge bathroom was fantastic, television and phone included!!

reviews.title: Top notch!
reviews.text: We were very sad to leave. The location was the best! You will not be dissapointed in the Pan Pacific. Out of curiousity, as we were walking around the city, we checked out some other hotel properties that we were considering from Trip Advisor. Just from the greeting we received, or lack of, they did not even compare to the Pan Pacific.

Where do I start? The Pan Pacific is one of the BEST hotels I've stayed at in San Francisco. Booked through Expedia for (I think) $140 a night for a Superior Room. Got at the hotel at about 2pm, and they checked me in early, which is great. Check-in was extremely quick. I also took an upgrade to a Pacific Suite for only $300 for my 4-night stay. I LOVED the suite I was upgraded to.
reviews.title: Perfect

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is just another hotel in a big city. It is a nice hotel, recently updated from what I could tell and the staff was friendly.
reviews.title: Big hotel, big city, typical Marriot

reviews.text: We had a room on the top floor which was nice since it blocked out some of the street noise.
reviews.title: Nice hotel

reviews.text: The beds were very comfortable and I slept like a baby, they also had a mini fridge for drinks and the bathroom was very nice.
reviews.title: Beautiful Hotel

reviews.text: It bothered me that they charged for internet, we ended up getting it for free since my husband is a platinum Marriott rewards member or something but I could not believe a "business" hotel charges for internet.
reviews.title: Great Conference Space

reviews.text: We did not try the restaurants as no meals were included but they always looked crowded so the food must have been good.
reviews.title: Great Service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was the first time that my girlfriend and I stayed in SF and we were unsure as to whether to stay at Fisherman’s Wharf or Union Sq. We decided on Union Sq. based on feedback on TripAdvisor and it was absolutely the correct decision. The area felt very safe both day and night which was important to us both.
reviews.title: JW was superb

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were delighted with the JW, the location was perfect, walking distance to all the shopping and restaurants around the Square (a 2 minute walk), the Cable Car and to Chinatown. Market St is about a 5-10 minute walk and there is loads of good shopping there too. It costs $10 maximum to get to Fisherman’s Wharf and there were always cabs available outside the hotel even over Thanksgiving when I imagine it is busier than usual. The hotel is also very near to all the car rental companies which was also really useful to us.
reviews.title: Great Hotel in San Fran
Fabulous!!
reviews.text: The hotel itself was perfect – we paid $179 a night and stayed on the 18th floor with a fantastic south-facing view. The room was great, a decent size, immaculate, quiet and had everything that you could need (you shouldn’t spend too much time in your room in this City anyway…)

The staff couldn’t have been more friendly and helpful. At the Concierge desk, Kyle Yergensen is worthy of a special mention for all the spot-on advice he gave us with regard to drinking and dining; a real credit to the hotel.
reviews.title: Not up to Marriott Standards (JW or not.)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We will absolutely stay here again when we return to San Francisco and I think the £100 a night rate is about right.
reviews.title: Just Average

reviews.text: I booked my Pan Pacific stay as part of a package deal on Expedia, as I was traveling there for a conference at the Moscone Center. My friends came, too, and they stayed in slightly nicer rooms (and paid handsomely for them) and we all had a terrific time at the Pan Pacific.
reviews.title: Luxurious base for hopping around the city!
Great Hotel, Great Location
reviews.text: Highlights include a fabulous bed, a gorgeous bathroom, a quiet stay and very good butler service. My room was a bit smaller than my friends' and on a lower floor but was nevertheless very comfortable, even though the furniture was just a bit worn and the windows were just a bit loose. The shower was a little too tiny and didn't get hot enough for my tastes, but the maid service was impeccable and I loved the room. It was quite a treat to stay at the Pan Pacific, too, because its location can't be beat.
Highly recommended if you can get a good deal on a room, and be sure to explore the neighborhood--it's very touristy and very pricey, but then you don't come to SF to save money!
reviews.title: Great location for San Francisco exploration
What a great hidden Treasure
reviews.text: Recently stayed at the Pan Pacific Hotel and we loved it. The location is within walking distance of the cable car lines, Union Square, the Bart and Chinatown.

reviews.title: Another great experience
reviews.text: The staff was wonderful, knowledgeable and very helpful.. The doorman even went out of his way to get us a nicer taxi,when we tried to use the towncar service and a towncar was not available.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Am a local, but we wanted to spend the night in the city. This hotel has excellent service. Everyone was wonderful and very helpful. The rooms were awesome. Nicely decorated and very clean. The bathroom was huge and had everything you could possibly want. I highly recommend this hotel for everyone. The hotel is within walking distance of Union Square and the downtown shopping areas.
reviews.title: Loved It !

likes.disliked: — The Lobby Bar was left unattended at times - no bartender

reviews.text: The hotel service was excellent, and no complaints. My visit was for business, and my associate and I were booked into adjoining rooms on the 10th floor. There was no view, but we had a government rate, and a view was not why we were there. The rooms were large and comfortable, and the robes were plush. The bathroom, although gorgeous, were problematic. I am fairly short (5' 2") and most of the counter space was a backsplash-sized ledge behind a large Kohler sink. It was difficult for me to reach most of my things over the sink. More bathroom counter space would have been nice, and I would have gladly given up the tv for the space. Similarly, the shower was tiny, even for someone my size. I am under 120 pounds, but I found the shower small and confining. (I hoped I did not drop the soap because there wasn't much room to bend down and pick it up!) The water pressure was also not that good. I would have preferred using the tub (which had a hand-held shower), but there was no curtain.
reviews.title: Nice hotel, but bathroom, although gorgeous, could use improvement

likes.disliked: — Bathroom -- not enough counter space, shower sub-par re size & water pressure

reviews.title: Great Room!
reviews.text: I would stay here again, but for the fact the bathrooms (a major concern when I stay) were not as functional as I want.

Stayed at this hotel when it was the Pan Pacific. The room was luxurious for the price. Most comfortable bed I've slept in. The bathroom was all marble with a tv and bathtub. The hotel itself is on the quieter side, no nightlife in the lobby but good for a relaxing stay.
reviews.title: Great Place and Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Having read the reviews for several major chain hotels on this website, we finally decided on JW Marriott. We were not disappointed. Location was great, just 1 block from Union Square and the cable car stop. Quiet location and handy to restaurants. We walked from the BART station at Powell St although uphill it was not that bad!. The hotel is due for refurbishment in Spring 2007. The rooms were spacious and comfortable. The front desk was helpful and friendly. We would stay here again.
reviews.title: Great stay and location

aka: Jw Marriott San Francisco Union Square Hotel San Francisco
